website_summaries.verdict: Alcohol-free and odorless, this is a reliable and fast-acting brush cleaner spray.
pros: Works great for busy make up artists and professionals who need quick cleaning of brushes and applicators
cons: A few customers found that the spray bottle gets clogged easily

customer_reviews.title: It’s the worst I’ve ever used. 😩
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand... the reviews seem great, but this product DID NOT work for me. In fact, it nearly ruined my favorite foundation brush. I have used high-end brush shampoos as well as cheap soap and hair shampoos. This was worse than anything. It actually left a weird, gummy residue on my brush bristles, causing them to clump. The suds and water were running clear, indicating the brush was clean, but my brush clearly still had foundation on it. I worked with this one brush for at least 15 minutes. I finally resorted to using Pantene hair shampoo, which worked. I’m so disappointed. 😩
customer_reviews.author: Bean

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I was using baby shampoo to wash my brushes because that's all I had on hand. It worked ok, but I wanted something a little more effective. This makeup brush shampoo works really well. It really does a good job getting my brushes clean. It has a pleasant scent that's not overpowering at all. It also washes out very easily. Also the packaging was great as it comes with a sticker closure to ensure it doesn't spill during shipment. My only critique is that I wish it was more conditioning as it tends to dry out my brushes a little. Overall it's a good product though and the price was nice.
customer_reviews.author: Jheneya

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected....disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a good buy based off of the good reviews, however, this did not work for me. It did not suds up or get my brushes clean. I will stick to using warm water, vinegar, and dawn in a shallow container, soak for 20 minutes and the brushes get clean with almost little effort.
customer_reviews.author: Tommi

customer_reviews.title: Cleans as well as MAC brush cleaner, but eco friendly
customer_reviews.text: I've been using MAC brush cleaner for years but ran out and needed something right away, so i took a chance and ordered this. I'm glad I did because this brush cleaner works amazing. It cleans just as well as the MAC and I paired it with this rotating brush cleaner and I think my brushes are the cleanest they've ever been...and its eco friendly. My only complaint is it leaves behind a scent that is a little strong.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Way Better Than I Thought!
customer_reviews.text: I was kind of hesitant and thought maybe the reviews were too good to be true ... but they aren't! I bought one of those makeup brush spinning cleaners and wasn't sure what to use with it. I had tried some Mary Kay makeup remover thinking that would work but it didn't. So I got this and did some hand washing as per the instructions and goops and goops of old makeup just flowed off (yes, that's gross and I will never let my brushes get THAT bad). Then I put it through the spinning machine and my brushes are back to the original "white" brissels that they are supposed to be! Highly recommend :)
customer_reviews.author: Anon1

customer_reviews.title: Performs as stated
customer_reviews.text: I decided, after about 10 years, to wear eyeshadow again. I purchased some from a high-end department store, but it did not include brushes. Store wanted $50 for 2 brushes. I pulled out my old makeup case and found 7 brushes I had purchased 16 years or so ago. They were from high-end department stores. I knew that I had never cleaned them during their 5-6 years of usage. This shampoo cleaned these brushes in record time. I think I cleaned all 7 brushes in less than 10 minutes. I hung them over the edge of the sink to dry. They look brand new. I am very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: mshumph

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money on this!
customer_reviews.text: Given the 4.7 star rating on this makeup brush cleaner, I really thought I was missing out on something good! The first time I tried this, I was immediately disappointed! Not only does it not get all the makeup off, it spreads around the oil from the makeup all over the place and takes 2-3 washings to get it all off! The Dollar Tree clarifying shampoo I had been using for years works better than this Ecotools cleaner! The only way this is worth more than a one star rating is if you’ve never cleaned your brushes ever in your life.
customer_reviews.author: Product User

customer_reviews.title: Photo of item is Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: The soap itself is a fantastic product and I love the scent of the soap in the mint green bottle. If you're looking for an environment and animal friendly brush soap I highly recommend this product. I've been using this brush soap for years so I was very excited to receive my new order. I believed I was purchasing the item in the product description (mint green colored bottle) but received a white bottle with a green label. The one I received is "scent free" but not truly. It has an unpleasant, but tolerable smell which is why I rated it four stars. I adored the scent of the shampoo that comes in the mint green bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly G

customer_reviews.title: I am a convert from baby shampoo!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using baby shampoo to clean my brushes, successfully (or so I thought) for a very long time. I bought this on a whim attempting to use up the last little bit of a gift card and then tried it on brushes I had already cleaned and hadn't used yet and SO MUCH came out of them, I was absolutely disgusted. I have been using this every Sunday for about a month now, and my brushes look and feel like new. I also haven't developed any more tiny bumps since switching from baby shampoo to this cleaner. I am definitely a convert, after years of scoffing at brush cleansers. Oops.
customer_reviews.author: TheLeeFamily

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the beauty blender liquid cleanser for my brushes and beauty blenders. It works okay and smells great but is super expensive. I just received this eco tools cleanser yesterday and I right away went to use it on my beauty blenders and most used makeup brush and OMG!! While I don't absolutely love the smell of this one, for the price and how well it works I can absolutely get used to it. My beauty blenders have not looked this clean since I first bought them and this stuff even got stains that the BB cleanser itself couldn't get out. Save your money and buy the eco tools!
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: REMOVES Foundation from brushes!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this but wanted to try it when I read about it. I had another brand that I was using to clean my brushes. I have to say this stuff worked GREAT. It cleaned even the foundation brush quickly and easily. The other cleaner I was using took many times to get it somewhat clean but this cleaner got the job done quicker and better!!! All of my brushes were soft and clean! Highly recommend this vs the other more costly cleaners by brand name cosmetic companies!
customer_reviews.author: Jean Caisse

customer_reviews.title: Clear & moisturized
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant to purchase b/c of the low price point (kind of a snob) but I'm so pleasantly surprised with the results. Works equally well on my natural and synthetic brushes. Just make sure you wash it out thoroughly , otherwise brushes feel dry (wash out until the 'squeaky' clean feeling is gone). I also like that this product (ecotools) doesn't build bacteria like cleaners that come as a bar of soap (eg. Sephora), I find it cleans equally if not better, and leaves brushes feeling moisturized. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Basic brush shampoo
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic brush shampoo. Basically if you’re worried about using soaps on a brush that aren’t advertised as brush soaps (Eg normal shampoo or dishwasher fluid or something) this is an easy to find option. However this doesn’t immediately strip all product off the brushes and even with rinsing I still end up with soap residue. It won’t get every stain out of my brushes. To have my brushes just be basically clean, it’s fine, but I recommend using a brush “washboard” with this.
customer_reviews.author: Author Sable Sylvan (Heather Davies)

customer_reviews.title: Great Brush Cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this brush cleaner! I will fill up a bowl of hot water and add this cleaner to it, and then another hot bowl of clear water to rinse out the brushes I've washed. This saves on water. Although, my foundation brush I will clean separately because I will have to put soap directly on it to clean it because it has more product soaked in. I'll just gently massage the soap in my brushes and rinse them out. It'll clean all the pigment out of my brushes! The soap smells a little odd, not bad, just odd. Overall I really like this soap.
customer_reviews.author: Nachos and Lemonheads on My Dad’s Boat

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Woah! I'm completely impressed. I have a foundation brush that is old as dirt and caked in product that I just never had the heart to throw away because it was my first makeup brush. I tried soooooo many cleaning products on it, even let it soak over night in a few things and nothing got all the build up out of it. I put some of this on it on a whim, left it for five minutes, rinsed, and my brush looks brand new again. There's zero product, the bristles actually separate and move again. I'm so impressed and happy.
customer_reviews.author: Hoy

customer_reviews.title: Works well with eco tool brishes
customer_reviews.text: I had to twist off the cap and pull the plastic off the bottle ( which I had to poke a hole through with scissors bc I couldn't get the tab off). I'm used to using a spray brush cleaner that I got from target. I don't mind this brush cleaner. The soap did get my brushes clean. It lathers nicely. And visibly lifts dirt/makeup from brushes. I don't like how long I had to rinse my brushes to be confident that all of the soap was off. I will continue to use until gone, but not sure if I will purchase again. Works well with eco tool brushes.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Miller

customer_reviews.title: ORDER THIS NOW
customer_reviews.text: Working in unison with my brush mat, this stuff is magic, or you can just rub the bristles between your two fingers if you don't have a mat. I bought an expensive brush from Bare Minerals that got stiff and grungy in the middle, and nothing would clean it up. After using this stuff, that brush is so clean, and its bristles feel soft like the little feathers on a baby duck's head. It doesn't take much product either. This bottle will last a long time. So order this brush cleaner right now. You'll be happy you did, Skippy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better that any brush shampoo I’ve ever used!
customer_reviews.text: This shampoo is the best thing that ever happened to my makeup brushes! It removed old makeup that I thought had stained my brushes for good, and left them super soft and fluffy. Baby shampoo ruined my favorite, very expensive brush, don't try that. Also, it’s worth mentioning that it’s only a fraction of the price as the shampoo from Sephora, and works amazing! Oh, and here’s a brush drying hack I learned on YouTube. Hair ties and a towel rack.
customer_reviews.author: Michi the vegan

customer_reviews.title: I think there's magic in this bottle!
customer_reviews.text: I use dark shadows often, so my brushes usually always have a tinge of color on them, even after washing. I bought a brush scrubber thingie that suction cups to the sink, and used this AMAZING smelling brush cleaner. I think there's magic in the bottle because not only are my brushes 100% clean, I didn't have to rinse them forever trying to get suds out. This is my 1st makeup brush shampoo purchase and there's no need for me to even test out any other brand! I will definitely be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: (mostly) does it's job
customer_reviews.text: This shampoo does great with cleaning most of my brushes except for my foundation brush. It does clean all the highlighter, blush and eyeshadow from the other brushes but it seems to stop at my Maybelline liquid foundation. I either have to use a lot more than the intended amount to get the brush completely clean or use the shampoo with some of my dove soap (which I was previously using) and even then the brush is cleaner than using the shampoo alone. It does an OK job--I just wish the cleaning power was a little stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Lele

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Not only do I use this on my make up brushes, I’ve used it on my paint brushes. It took the acrylic paint out with ease. I’ve also used it to treat my shirt when I got paint on it. Rubbed it in, (paint was fresh), and washed the shirt. Saved that shirt. So to say it cleans my makeup brushes is kind of an understatement. It’s a wonderful product and I’ll definitely be buying more of it. Does it come in the gallon size? Kidding.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Christenson

customer_reviews.title: You'll never buy another brand again
customer_reviews.text: I'm absolutely obsessed with this stuff. I've tried several other brands and NOTHING compares to this stuff. A little goes a long way and a bottle lasts me a long time. It easily takes all the makeup off brushes and sponges. It's cruelty free which is a must and is free of all the nasty chemicals in most products (that you do not want on your face). It easily removes water proof products. Use with a cleaning mat and you will easily clean your brushes in minimal time. I have fairly sensitive skin and have never had an issue. it doesn't leave any residue on my brushes. This product is great and super affordable.
customer_reviews.author: LLV

customer_reviews.title: Better then mac
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a avid mac user. I normally buy the mac makeup brush cleaner but I wanted to try this instead. ALOT cheaper on price but not on quality. I absouletly love this cleaner. It was easier to use and got my blush brush back to its normal color and nothing has done that. Not unless I did several washes. I just wish I could subscribe and save to this product!!! I highly recommend this product. Not only does it clean the brushes but it leaves them super soft!!!
customer_reviews.author: Monique Lunn

customer_reviews.title: Leaves brushes soft, no suds
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical of this brush cleaner. I had heard most brush cleaners are hard to rinse and the brushes are slow to dry. That's not true of this cleaner! There are no suds, or very, very little suds. As soon as I put the cleaner on the brush the makeup residue surfaces and in a minute or less the brush is clean and rinsed and drying. My now clean brushes dry very quickly! They are soft and ready to be used. I was surprised by the size of the bottle, it will last a long time. A great price for an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. D in TN

customer_reviews.title: Mild Formula, Leaves Brushes Soft
customer_reviews.text: This shampoo works better for me when cleaning my makeup brushes than the previous shampoo I was using. It leaves my brushes really soft. If the brush is especially dirty or has dark pigments in it, I sometimes have to lather and rinse this shampoo more than once. It doesn't have any odors and leaves a soft, clean, brush when dry. I have recommended this product to friends and I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Denver's Mom

customer_reviews.title: I am recommending this to all my friends
customer_reviews.text: I am about to expose myself, but I had not washed my brushes in over a year (I know super gross) I was going to buy a new set, but decided to try this. I wasn't expecting much, but then my foundation brush (the bristles were sticking together there was so much product built-up) was super clean in a few mins I was blown away. I do recommend getting a brush mat as it will really clean your brushes and cut the labor in half. (also i'm washing my brushes more often now (>0< )
customer_reviews.author: CCxSuga

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Short of Miraculous
customer_reviews.text: I've been skeptical about items that seem like glorified soap but got it as a gift. This cleaned my brushes like nothing else, with just a drop, a few seconds of spreading it around, and literally about 10 seconds of swishing in warm water. It was unbelievable. It took out weeks of caked on 24-hour concealer and foundation and left my brush soft and fluffy like it were brand new. I will always use this (and my brushes will always be clean!).
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: Great Brush Cleaner, Love that it’s also hypoallergenic and cruelty free
customer_reviews.text: I really like this makeup brush shampoo. I’ve tried lots of other brands but this one is by far the best. My brushes are without a doubt cleaner than with any other products I’ve tried (omg! I can see the white parts of the bristles again!) but at the same time, it’s not super abrasive since the brushes stay soft and retain their shape. I’ve also become more sensitive to face products (makeup, soap, lotion) as I’ve aged so the fact that this is hypoallergenic is awesome. Last but not least, I love that it’s cruelty free!
customer_reviews.author: melrom

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I feel like all these amazing reviews are people getting paid or discounts? It wasn’t any better than water. Nothing comes off the brush. I even tested a brush I cleaned with this and squirted some micellar water in the brush after(which typically I use on my skin) and all this brown make up cake off the brush. It wasn’t cleaned at all from the brush cleaned. Never buying again. Waste of money. I find it hilarious how people are saying it works great with a brush spinner. Ya the spinner is what’s works great, not this bottle of useless stuff. Can’t even call it cleanser or soap or anything of the sort.
customer_reviews.author: LoveLoveLove1999

customer_reviews.title: Very cleansing!
customer_reviews.text: The soap in this does a great job of breaking down the makeup in my brushes. A little goes a long way so this bottle will last me a while. I will never buy another brush cleaner again because of how well this works! The soap foams up rather well and because it is clear, the foam is white. This light color allows you to see if there is any makeup still in the brush because it will change the color of the foam.
customer_reviews.author: Paisley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the lazy brush owner!
customer_reviews.text: I am LAZY when it comes to cleaning my brushes, but after finding a set I actually like and want to keep nice, I decided to give this a whirl. I’ve used several DIY ‘recipes’ but have been wholly unimpressed with them. With this, there was no nasty smell after, they dried quickly, and my brushes are SO CLEAN! I did have to ‘rinse and repeat’ several times because there was a fair amount of build-up, but in no time, my fave brushes look brand new! Do your skin & brushes a favor and stock up!
customer_reviews.author: KC Carter

customer_reviews.title: Smells nice
customer_reviews.text: when I first tried this I was expecting to use a lot since before I use hand soap on my makeup brushes when I just used about a quarter size of this product that's all I needed and all of my makeup came out my brushes were a little bad so I use a little bit more but this is great and it smells nice and it makes your brushes feel soft
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Cleaned my hardest to clean brushes
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. I have some really dense brushes that are super hard to clean. I put water in a jar with this shampoo and put the brushes in to soak for a few minutes (just the brush part, not enough water to reach where the bristles are glued in). The super dense ones took 3 washes (they were pretty nasty tbh) and my regular brushes just took 1. Worth the buy
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: It’s just OK
customer_reviews.text: I don’t really get the hype. It smells pleasant but doesn’t do much on my foundation and concealer brushes. I had to go back and rewash those with my old standby Dr Bronners. This is fine for brushes used with powders or eyeshadows only but the performance is not at all what I was expecting after hearing several of my fave YouTube beauty channels swear by this product.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth H.

customer_reviews.title: My n egative review was removed!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon deleted my review because I questioned the authenticity of the product because the bottle and label are not the same as the usual bottle I buy. They said they verified its authenticity (not sure how but ok) so that’s why they removed my review. I guess it doesn’t matter that the cleanser barely cleans my makeup brushes. So now Amazon is silencing customers too. Wow!!
customer_reviews.author: CatD

customer_reviews.title: Thouroughly cleans and quickly rinses brushes
customer_reviews.text: I wash my brushes weekly and I didn't think I would need a special cleanser for my makeup brushes..a mild shampoo was working just fine but as I have several of their brushes I gave this Ecotools product a try and I'm glad I did. It foams up enough so that you can see it's working and does a great job of quickly cleaning all my brushes..natural hair and synthetic. The brushes cleaned quickly and completely with only a little product and quickly rinsed clean. It smells nice..a light fresh clean scent and tgecprice was good. Will definitely repurchase.
customer_reviews.author: peasantmama

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cleaner for your makeup brushes
customer_reviews.text: Disclaimer: I am a novice at serious makeup and/or makeup brushes. I recently purchased a set of makeup brushes and I needed something besides hand soap to clean them with. Amazon reviews are my go-to when I need help in selecting a product. They didn't fail me this time, as this cleaner does the job well and is super easy to use. It helps me to be diligent about cleaning my brushes after every use, which is a great thing.
customer_reviews.author: Santa Barbara Gal

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I've never been good at cleaning my makeup brushes. I'll go more than a year easily. Having this shampoo has been very motivating for me to actually clean them. I've had it for less than 2 months and I've already cleaned my brushes twice. That's a freaking record for me. Lathers well, cleans nicely, and rinses out easily. No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Christy A. Risher

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have the beautyblender liquid cleanser from Sephora and it’s what I used to compare to this one. For $7.99, this product did not disappoint. It’s formula was not as thick or concentrated as I would have like but I LOVE how it smells. On the first scrubbing, i could see the original color of the bristles come back but I ended up giving my brush a second scrubbing and looked like new! All in all it did it’s job.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: ... have used this several times now and it works fine for my brushes used for eye shadow but not ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used this several times now and it works fine for my brushes used for eye shadow but not the brushes I use for foundation. I use Revlon Colorstay Liquid Foundation and I have tried to clean the brushes several times with shampoo. I ended up using my Dial hand soap to get it clean, which did work. I will use it o my eye shadow brushes until it gone but will not repurchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Best makeup brush cleaner I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: This brush cleaner really works. I pour some into the sink with some warm water, let my brushes soak for a couple of minutes, and then use a scrubbing egg to get the makeup off. My brushes come out really clean and I'm able to keep them for several years without cleanliness problems. The shampoo rinses out well and does not break down the brush hairs. This has become one of my gift items for friends.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Owens

customer_reviews.title: Almost Great
customer_reviews.text: The product works well for the price, got my brushes and sponges clean, but more than half of the product leaked out in the box all over some other items I ordered. The box had no damage or sign of being crushed, the safety seal was obviously messed up from the beginning or there was some other issue. Probably won't purchase again for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Smells Amazing!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I bought this!! It smells amazing (kind of fruity but not too fruity, and clean) It works really well too. I don’t think my brushes have ever been cleaner. I’ve used other cleansers for brushes, dish soap, shampoo, etc and this works the best so far. Plus it smells great and I feel like it’s probably less stripping to my brushes than other economical options (soaps and shampoos). I also think the price is good. Pretty big bottle for like 5$. Go ahead and grab it!
customer_reviews.author: PFamily

customer_reviews.title: It works ok
customer_reviews.text: I go this to clean my makeup brushes and it works ok, but I have to clean them several times with the makeup brush cleaner set that I got seperately. Honestly, using Dawn detergent still works best. It may be because I live in Florida so most of my makeup is waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: BlueDevil Angel

customer_reviews.title: No scent and works great.
customer_reviews.text: I love eco brushes and their green sponge so thought I'd give this a try. Unlike Cinema Secrets, there's no scent and it works wonderfully with a makeup brush mat. Rinses off the brushes easily and it's economical. I put a two tblspns in a glass votive candle holder I bought at the $1 store, wet the brush, dip, brush it on the mat and rinse. Sometimes two brushes at a time. I'd recommend this product for any makeup brush.
customer_reviews.author: Melner

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: I originally got this product for my mom for mother's day one year and ended up stealing her bottle after she said she didn't need so much. This brush shampoo worked WONDERS on my nasty brushes. Some of them had 2-3 year old foundation on them that came right off (yes I know it's gross but nobody told me I needed to wash my brushes!) They looked good as new and I was so thrilled! I used it with a little scrubby pad (elf I think) just to get some of the really cake-y ones clean. The bottle is large and I don't have many brushes so this should last me about 1-1.5 years and all for $5?!? Worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Mei Lee

customer_reviews.title: A favorite
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my granddaughter as she is wanting to be a makeup artist. This cleaner was the perfect partner to the artists makeup brushes she has. They are expensive and this cleaner really gets them clean without a lot of work. She says the brushes come out just like new. So I give this cleaner five stars on her behalf.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Saylor

customer_reviews.title: Works but too liquidy
customer_reviews.text: This shampoo took work but it's very liquidy. It would drip all over the bottle everytime I used it. I think if the shampoo was thicker, it would have been the perfect shampoo, but it did its job and my brushes were 100% clean and soft everytime. I would say, purchase this bottle but dump it in a different bottle with a pump so it will be less messy. I'll purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Your Brushes Will Look Brand NEW
customer_reviews.text: I have just cleansed 9 brushes and a beauty blender. I had no idea there was so much makeup deep in my brushes The process was easy and efficient. My brushes are soft and clean as brand new. They LOOK brand new I also question someone saying the solution smells bad It does not I am a convert. This stuff is great
customer_reviews.author: Bon

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for cleaning my makeup brushes. Easy to use once I read the directions. Squirt onto brush then kind of work it down to the roots of the brush. You need more than a couple of drops to do a thorough job. Rinse thoroughly then lie flat on a towel to dry. Brushes looked brand new when dried.
customer_reviews.author: Kim H

customer_reviews.title: Best cleaner I’ve tried, well worth trying for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about purchasing this because of how cheap it was. I’m so glad I purchased it though. This is by far the best brush cleaner I’ve tried and I’ve tried some expensive ones. You’ll see in my picture before and after. Oh it smells really good as well and after drying my brushes are back to being soft and like new. Will purchase in the future again!
customer_reviews.author: CrazyNorac80

customer_reviews.title: Miracle clean
customer_reviews.text: I love to wash my brushes with this. And I started using reusable cloths to clean my make up, and rather than using regular soap to wash them. I use this and it removes everything. I posted pics so you can see both sides of make up on the cloth wipe. Third one is the after result, same with brushes. I will definitely buy again. It has no scent and you don’t need to use a lot to get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Shoppingislife

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if this product works as well as I'd like it to... Not even sure it's worth purchasing. I think if get the same outcome using regular shampoo and doubt I'd buy this again. As far as it doing what it says... I guess it does. It does clean nearly as well as a MAC brush cleaner, so price may be the primary reason to use this over something else.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Miracle Cleaner! Gets Rid of YEARS of Buildup!
customer_reviews.text: I’m ashamed to admit this, but I have never cleaned my makeup brushes until tonight. Yes I know, so bad! But I never cared or thought that I used them enough for them to be cleaned. I ended up buying this product with a gift card, because why not. LET ME TELL YOU GUYS. Between this brush shampoo and a scrubbing mat, I got YEARS worth of product off of my brushes! They came out looking and feeling brand new! I actually saw what color my brushes used to be when I first bought them! I wish I had taken before and after photos! Seriously, if you use makeup applicators, buy this now.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Jo Samsill

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cleaner but...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent cleaner but...it does not condition. This cleaner does an excellent job cleaning my makeup brushes, I use my brushes heavily all week then I clean (a bunch!) them. Its great! And I have SEVERAL high end brush cleaners and there’s no comparison! For all of those who do not like this cleaner, list cleaners that are better! Because I have tried many. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Proud Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get this!
customer_reviews.text: I never knew that they had shampoo for makeup brushes, even though I have been into Makeup for a long time, Well I am happy I now found it because this is just amazing. It cleans my brushes so well! it takes all the gunk off, which of course who does not love clean brushes.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Galvan

customer_reviews.title: Impressive item!
customer_reviews.text: Ok I must say I have tried many makeup washes since the 90’s from shisedo to Mac to off brands and this by far has been the best! Plus I have very sensitive skin where I break out with the finest brands out there and this is great! Especially for sponges. I do though keep the Mac remover (I put it in a mini spray bottle as a quick remover for my brushes but for a weekly deep cleaning this is a must have!
customer_reviews.author: La Kim

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job Quickly and With Little Mess
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for keeping make-up brushes clean. I use it on my brushes when they start to look a little "loaded" and the makeup quickly disappears as I rinse them off. There is no scent. It is easy to use on one brush or with a few brushes at a time. The product has not damaged any of my brushes fibers, either natural or synthetic.
customer_reviews.author: Trvl  Jnky

customer_reviews.title: Works no better than bar soap
customer_reviews.text: Works no better than bar soap. I applied the shampoo and thoroughly massaged it into the brush twice, using my fingers as well as a silicone makeup brush cleaning egg and found that my foundation brush was greasy the next day. And I had only used the brush once since I last cleaned it prior to cleaning with this product. In other words, the brush wasn't very dirty to start with. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lorahbee

customer_reviews.title: Works well and reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. It easily cleans my makeup brushes without leaving any residue and you only need a small bit to wash each brush. I like to pour the soap on a little rubber scrubber to wash the brushes more thoroughly but have found that just using my fingers to work the soap through the brushes works well too.
customer_reviews.author: Ella

customer_reviews.title: This soap y’all
customer_reviews.text: INCREDIBLE! I’ve been using baby shampoo (and a bar soap and a solid soap) for years like a FOOL! I recently used this in conjunction with a cleaning mat, and I swear my brushes have never been this clean. It got them cleaner faster and far better than ever before. It didn’t work as well for my sponge, but it did work for it. I still think a hotel bar soap gets my sponge cleaner than anything else. But for your brushes you’ve got to at least try it.
customer_reviews.author: Jourdan

customer_reviews.title: Takes forever to wash out
customer_reviews.text: This shampoo takes a few washes to wash out of my synthetic and goat hair makeup brushes. I've tried using my hands vs a cleansing mat, hot water vs cold, and I can't figure it out. I don't have hard water so that's not it. I have better luck using regular shampoo than this special brush shampoo. Even after multiple washes, my brushes have a slick residue on them, which means I need to do a few more washes.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: brushes are so cllleaaaannnnn!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: you never really know how dirty your makeup brushes are until you buy a specialized cleaner. it really does make a difference. i was even able to clean out old stains on my beauty blender that i thought were permanent. you get a lot in this bottle cuz just a small dab will clean each brush very well. i've used this for several months now and haven't had any allergic reaction. do it, buy this for your face.
customer_reviews.author: jen k

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cleaning makeup sponges
customer_reviews.text: Has a pleasant and gentle shampoo scent, not strong or harsh. I use it to clean my makeup sponges: get the sponge wet so it expands to its full size, squirt on a dime-sized amount of brush cleaner, massage it in with your fingers, and then squeeze it out under the tap until the water runs clear. Quickly and easily cleans, and my sponges look nearly new. I feel so much better knowing I'm not putting old makeup or germs on my face. The bottle does tend to get a little messy, as some product will run down the sides, but it's easy to rinse off.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This cleans my makeup brushes so well! I use it with the silicon cleaning pad and my brushes come out like new every time after they've dried. I usually only have to use 1-2 drops (2-3 for my foundation brush) and they come out so clean. This is a plus because it's a decent sized bottle and you don't use much of it at a time! Sometimes if I go too long without cleaning my brushes I have to wash and rinse twice but that's my own fault, not the fault of the product. This is something I'll keep buying!
customer_reviews.author: Amber_Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Smells great, works amazing
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really works, it suds up a bit and got my white brushes clean. I didn’t have to use much product, just a small drop per brush. For the stubborn ones, I washed them twice. I used hot and warm water to clean them and used my DIY brush cleanser palette (just a bunch of squiggles and dots with hot glue on an old plastic lid). Works great!
customer_reviews.author: maihiro

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I'm a cosmetologist and I'm ashamed to say as far as my brushes that I use on myself I have never cleaned so I bought this and let me tell ya this is the stuff it only takes depending on how big the brush is a drop or two and washing it for a few mins rinsing it out good and boom its clean and I mean clean like new I was very happy/pleased with this product I'll be getting more when the time comes
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Barnhill

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: So, I am one of those girls that isn't super into makeup and honestly use makeup brushes until they are so disgusting I buy new ones (cheap ones because, again, I suck at makeup). Quarantine has me doing anything to stay occupied though. I saw this stuff on a video and decided to order. Omg, it is amazing. Like I have rinsed my brushes with water before and thought I was doing a good job. When I added this soap, it is like the makeup fell out. It was crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Scent it leaves is too strong and I like scented products
customer_reviews.text: The scent it leaves on my blender is too strong and I like scented products. I even usually like scented products, ones that other people hate like City Airspun! But I can hardly get my Tati Blendiful to my face without the sugary scent bothering me. It's too bad because it works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Mad Midwest Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: I had been using the soap that came with my Beautyblender brand sponge to wash my brushes - as I no longer use beauty sponges - but wanted to give this a try. For the price, I would say it’s a fair purchase but I did feel it took me much longer to try and get foundation of my brushes with this wash than my BB soap. If you’re strapped for cash, I do think this is a worthy purchase nonetheless, but if you have the spending money then I would suggest finding a stronger wash for your brushes.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: I'm always skeptical when I order brush cleaning shampoos because some definitely work better than others. I have sensitive skin and this one works really well for me. It's a gentle cleaner, smells great, and does the trick. Will definitely be purchasing again in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Kait

customer_reviews.title: Stunned!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how well this stuff works! I invested in a few MAC brushes and wanted to take care of them with a brush cleaner instead of the diluted alcohol I have always used. Wow--I should have been using this all along! I can't get over the amount of makeup (especially foundation) this removes from the brush. I plan on making this part of my weekly regimen. Will ABSOLUTELY reorder when I'm through with this bottle. VERY pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really great product! Just not in love with the smell...
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time cleaning my old makeup brushes recently as well as some new ones I had just purchased before using them for the first time and this stuff was so great! A little went a long way (along with a brush scrubber) and I really felt as though it cleaned things very thoroughly. I am not in love with the smell, which is why I took off a star (especially because it is coming in contact with my face via the brushes and does linger after they have dried) but if I liked orange-y smells I'd give it 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: I like this brush cleaner very well
customer_reviews.text: Love this cleaner will buy when I need more! Cleans your brushes very well and quick you don’t need to scrub them on a pad nothing just dabbing it and running your finger on it and it’s done “. Easy rinse it don’t not stay stuck in the brush and brush dries. ERY SOFT!! Just like new!!! They look brand new!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I used this brush shampoo today on my brushes and on my beauty blender. It got my brushes clean, but I also used a brush cleaning pad so I didn’t know how well it worked in its own. I then used it on my beauty blender and it got it so clean! Like it was actually pink again. It worked better than using dish soap and oil.
customer_reviews.author: Product reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product!
customer_reviews.text: I HATE cleaning my makeup brushes but I don't any more! This shampoo truly works and cut my cleaning time in half! It easily turned my large powder brush from grimy tan to creamy white (the original color)with only two small squirts of this shampoo. Washed out easily. Eye shadow brushes cleaned up with one tiny squirt and just a little rubbing. If you hate cleaning your brushes or have a hard time with the current cleaner you use, BUY THIS! It's worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: T. Kirks

customer_reviews.title: Super impressed
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I waited so long to buy a brush cleansing shampoo, but I'm thrilled this was my first one. (I was just using whatever hand soap I had at my bathroom sink.) This shampoo worked incredibly well. It dissolved the make-up like magic and left my brushes soft. The fragrance is super subtle and fresh. And hello, it's cheap! I wish I could add this to my subscribe and save box.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Byrnes

customer_reviews.title: Definitely buy if you use makeup everyday or even some days
customer_reviews.text: I had been cleaning my brushes with another brand and I bought this because I was running out. When I cleaned my brushes so much makeup came out I was shocked. This cleans so well that my pink brushes (which were white when I bought them) were actually white again. It seems amazing and the breakouts (due to dirty brushes) I had been having stopped.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: concentrated, overwhelming scent but gets the job done well
customer_reviews.text: probably the cheapest makeup brush cleanser I've ever seen. It works miracles, a little goes a long way!! Just remember to throughly clean it out. I don't love the scent, but I am pretty sensitive to smell and this gets to be a lot very quickly for me. its super SUPER hard to clean if it spills. mine broke in a suitcase and cleaning it out from everything was a MESS. be careful when traveling with it. but overall great for make up brushes and sponges. I clean mine weekly and the bristles are still the way they were initially. This is my second bottle.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: I love this product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product!! I have never washed my brushes before. Once they get too dirty I usually just replace them. I thought I would give this a try and I do not regret it. It works quick and easy and I can definitely see the difference. I will definitely purchase this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing + weird smell
customer_reviews.text: Not entirely even sure this got the job done properly. Had so many high ratings and it was super affordable, so I thought maybe this was gonna be a good product. I had already noticed the smell as I was washing my brushes, but chose to ignore it... the weird smell ended up sticking to my brushes AND left a super weird residue??? I brushed one of my bigger brushes against my skin for a feel, and it left that part of my skin feeling so icky. I'll be sticking to baby shampoo.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Lam

customer_reviews.title: Great brush AND sponge cleaner
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is very good and gets all the makeup out of brushes. It smells good and lathers a lot. A little goes a long way depending on how dirty and the size of your sponge/brush. My only gripe is that it's a bit small so if you're someone who wears makeup daily (and full glam) i suggest you buy 2 or 3 bottles of it. Or you can buy some Aussie moist shampoo (yes for your hair) that'll do the trick and it's also affordable and big. Otherwise great product. it leaves brushes soft and clean. Will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Craig

customer_reviews.title: GREATEST PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Listen, if you want to clean your makeup brushes, this is the way to go. The shampoo is so smooth and smells SO good!!!!! It cleans the brushes so conveniently and beautifully. It takes literally 5 seconds. You apply the shampoo, run it under hot water, and use your hand or a mat to get the grime out. I've recommended this product to my roommates and strangers alike. Please, PLEASE, make your life easier with this product. It's a lifesaver.
customer_reviews.author: Sam B.

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always used the Elf Brush Shampoo but it never got all of the makeup off my brushes and it would feel all gunky and weird after I’d wash them. When I used this shampoo, one wash and my brushes looked absolutely brand new. It foamed very easily and it washed my brushes to completely brand new. I’ll be buying this over and over again! I highly recommend. The smell just smells like a nice clean shampoo and doesn’t bother me and the brush doesn’t feel weird after it’s washed.
customer_reviews.author: Paulina

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I shamefully must admit that I have NEVER cleaned my makeup brushes... I'm not the type who wears much make up, but I'm pretty sure that is unhealthy since I've had the same brushes since I was like 12! I had tried just rinsing them with water and not much would come out, so I figured they were pretty clean. Once I put this remover on them, I was shocked at how much crap came out. My brush totally changed to being light and airy. I didn't even realize how much makeup was weighing it down. I now clean my brushes whenever I think about it and I also use this to rinse makeup from my Norwex face cloth!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaves brushes looking and feeling brand new!
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit, I had been using my brushes for WAY too long without washing them. This brush shampoo worked wonders and left my brushes looking brand new and very soft! I have a few brushes from past ipsy bags that were beautiful when I first bought them with both white and colorful bristles which immediately looked kind of gross after using them with various products. After using this shampoo, they looked brand new!! I will definitely continue using and repurchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: k2allison

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work at all
customer_reviews.text: Im not sure why it has so many good reviews but I hate it. The shampoo for my hair works 10 times better than this! You can see on the photo that there is still foundation on the brush even though I used the shampoo at least 4 times....
customer_reviews.author: Laura Ferry

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I like the price of this product. I’ve used it on different brands of makeup brushes and it has left them all nice and clean. None of my brushes have been ruined. It does a really good job at getting color/foundation out
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Eh, ok, but not powerful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with high expectations and didn’t feel like it lived up to them. I used this with me new spinning brush cleaner. I had built up liquid foundation and contour powder brushes to clean. This shampoo smelled nice and helped clean my brushes but still left a lot of makeup behind. I cleaned my brushes with some olive oil then baby shampoo after I used this and I was able to get off much more makeup. Just stick to that and save your money.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Used this product to clean some pretty caked on foundation and eyeshadow brushes. They probably hadn’t been cleaned in 6 months, gross I know, but this product cleans pretty well. It smells perfectly fine and doesn’t leave a strong scent on the brush. My only complaint is that the bottle leaks, so it has to be stored upright. In my opinion, baby shampoo works better and you get more for your money without the mess
customer_reviews.author: Lauren B

customer_reviews.title: Good brush cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I’m only giving this 4 stars because it didn’t get all the makeup off one of my brushes (it was a cream makeup), but after several cleanings it did clean up my brushes and refresh them. I will continue to use.
customer_reviews.author: Taiya114

customer_reviews.title: My makeup tools look like new again!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I gave this cleaner a try! It has cleaned my makeup brushes so thoroughly, and I even tried it on makeup sponges and pressed powder puffs with great success. Normally I would not be able to get the foundation out of those sponges and powder puffs but after using Ecotools, they look like new! I will keep ordering this product to keep all of my brushes, sponges and other makeup tools looking like I just purchased them!
customer_reviews.author: H. Romeo

customer_reviews.title: Best beauty blender and makeup brush cleanser!
customer_reviews.text: This product is the most affordable and best makeup brush cleanser I've purchased. My beauty blender and makeup brushes look new after using this product weekly. There is a somewhat unpleasant scent, and truthfully, there is no need for a fragrance, especially for those who have skin sensitivities. Regardless, I will be ordering again.
customer_reviews.author: Miraj Patel

customer_reviews.title: Best I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I have used many cleansers for my make-up brushes. This is by far the best. I have a couple of white tipped brushes that are many years old and have always had a slight tint to them. Using this the first time, the tips on these brushes are super white - like brand new. Great price as well - my previous product by Bare Escentuals cost more than twice as much. I am a big fan of this product!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Great and quick!
customer_reviews.text: Loved using this. My sister and I get each other makeup items that we love for our birthdays. This was a quick and easy way to sanitize my makeup brushes and easier to use than the neutrogena makeup cleaning face wash I used to use to wash my brushes.
customer_reviews.author: CMC

customer_reviews.title: Cleans my brushes!
customer_reviews.text: This gets all of the makeup out of my brushes - ALL OF IT! That I have never experienced and it is awesome. I feel so clean! I might use about a tablespoon per brush wash. I will definitely be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Alie

customer_reviews.title: My only regret is taking this long to buy this..
customer_reviews.text: I've been cleaning my brushes/sponges using other means for a decade and always assumed that it was totally normal for staining to occur due to foundation, etc. I bought this product the other day and you should've seen my face when I used it on my most "stained" brush. It looks brand spanking new - no exaggeration. This is magical science in a bottle. I was so giddy I proceeded to clean every single brush and sponge right there and then and I'm still amazed by how fantastic this cleaner is. You really can't go wrong with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Aurality

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Works better than anything else I have tried and it has a great, light citrus scent. It gets the white of my brushes back to white. On my thicker foundation brush there is still some residual in the in the center but I’m not sure anything could penetrate into there. I will definitely be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!  Made My Brushes New Again!
customer_reviews.text: This cleaned my makeup brushes to 'new' condition. I was surprised it worked as well as it did. I will definitely buy this product again. I got my brushes wet, put a little brush shampoo in my hand, swirled the brushes in my hand with a little water and the shampoo, then rinsed. I did this twice for each brush and they all came out looking brand new. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Heather C.

customer_reviews.title: Didnt work for me
customer_reviews.text: I always do my due diligence and look at reviews. I decided to give this product a try because I've been using my face wash to clean my makeup brushes. Well, I used this product today and my brushes definitely are not clean. I'll be going back to using my face wash because that worked. Wish I could return.
customer_reviews.author: It's private

product_meta.title: Ecotools Makeup Brush Cleaner Cleansing Shampoo, 6 oz
product_meta.description: The EcoTools MAKEUP BRUSH SHAMPOO is designed to wash away makeup, oil and impurities from your brushes to improve their performance, and give you a smoother makeup application. The shampoo is dermatologist tested, hypoallergenic, and free of parabens, phthalates, and petroleum-based ingredients to leave brushes clean, soft and healthy. We've always believed in the power of beauty. At EcoTools we encourage you to embrace your own individual meaning of beauty and share it with the world, whether it is makeup tutorials, an inspirational story or giving back to the community. Because when you feel truly beautiful, you will make the world and everyone around you feel beautiful! Armed with a mission to make women look beautiful on the outside and feel just as good on the inside, sisters Jen and Stacey set out to create a brush collection that was not only nature friendly, but chic, high-quality, and affordable too. After sourcing recycled materials, renewable bamboo and better manufacturing processes, in 2007, EcoTools was born. This year, we’re celebrating EcoTools’ 10th anniversary by introducing a fresh new look, brushes that feel even better in your hands, and packaging with detailed tutorials that make it easier than ever to create a beautiful look from hair to toe. We’re also marking a decade of living beautifully by making a $100,000 donation to Glamour’s The Girl Project via our #MyTrueBeauty campaign that supports women’s empowerment and encourages women to become the best version of themselves. We believe in giving a new purpose to old things. That’s why our products are made from recycled aluminum and plastic. Our packaging is made of 100% Tree-Free paper. HOW? With 20% cotton and 80% bamboo fibers! The handles on our products are made of renewable bamboo, one of the fastest growing plants on the planet!
feature_bullets: Cleanses makeup brushes, applicators, and makeup sponges without leaving oily residue on the bristles
Safe for weekly use with a gentle massage or a brush cleaning mat
Dermatologist tested, hypoallergenic and free of parabens, phthalates, and petroleum-based ingredients
High quality, environmentally friendly makeup brushes, sponges, brush cleaners, spa products, face & body care products made of recycled aluminum & plastic with renewable bamboo
POWER OF BEAUTY: Aside from our quality cruelty free & vegan makeup products, we support women's empowerment & for women to become the best version of themselves.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
